alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 5:20AM PST until March 04 at 5:50PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .No additional hydrologically significant rain is in the forecast for the next few days. The flood crest on the Chehalis will arrive at Grand Mound late Wednesday morning and at Porter Thursday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River At Porter. * WHEN...Until Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood low pasture lands and some roads. High tidal levels at Aberdeen will worsen flooding along the lower reaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 48.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 48.7 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 130 PM PST.
